meanings.definition: To produce or provide a greater amount or quantity than something else.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree outyielded the pear tree in the number of fruits produced.
meanings.sent2: The new farming technique outyielded the old method in crop production.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outyielded the big grasshopper in gathering food for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outyielded all obstacles in her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outyielded the other flowers in the garden, standing tall and proud.

meanings.definition: To surpass in yielding or producing.
meanings.sent1: The student outyielded his classmates in the science fair project.
meanings.sent2: The new technology outyielded the previous model in efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outyielded the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His creativity outyielded all expectations, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent5: The champion outyielded all competitors, securing the first-place trophy.
